front.title: Maintaining Protocols Using Grease and Variability

abstract.t: Long-term interoperability of protocols is an important goal of the network standards process. Deployment success can depend on supporting change, which can include modifying how the protocol is used, extending the protocol, or replacing the protocol. This document presents concepts, considerations, and techniques related to protocol maintenance, such as greasing or variability. The intended audience is protocol designers and implementers.
